intro: Rapanea myricoides, commonly known as the African snowbush, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It features dense, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in some parts of the world as a garden plant.
